intro: Schoenobiblus, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas, particularly in Mexico and the southwestern United States. They are characterized by their compact growth habit and dense, grass-like foliage. Schoenobiblus species typically produce small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink, red, or purple. These plants are well adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and efficient water use.
